properties.name: appearance
properties.description: Specifies the appearance of the content control.

examples.description: Set the appearance of a building block gallery content control to show a bounding box around it

properties.name: buildingBlockCategory
properties.description: Specifies the category for the building block content control.

examples.description: Set the building block category to "General" for a building block gallery content control

properties.name: buildingBlockType
properties.description: Specifies a BuildingBlockType value that represents the type of building block for the building block content control.

examples.description: Set a building block gallery content control to display only "Headers" type building blocks

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the red-green-blue (RGB) value of the color of the content control. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format.

examples.description: Set the color of a building block gallery content control to blue (#0000FF)

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a building block gallery content control to verify the connection to the Word host application and log its API version.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets the identification for the content control.

examples.description: Get and display the unique identifier of a building block gallery content control in the document.

properties.name: isTemporary
properties.description: Specifies whether to remove the content control from the active document when the user edits the contents of the control.

examples.description: Set a building block gallery content control to be automatically removed when the user edits its contents

properties.name: level
properties.description: Gets the level of the content controlâ€”whether the content control surrounds text, paragraphs, table cells, or table rows; or if it is inline.

examples.description: Check if a building block gallery content control is inline or at paragraph level and log the result to the console.

properties.name: lockContentControl
properties.description: Specifies if the content control is locked (can't be deleted). true means that the user can't delete it from the active document, false means it can be deleted.

examples.description: Lock a building block gallery content control to prevent users from deleting it from the document

properties.name: lockContents
properties.description: Specifies if the contents of the content control are locked (not editable). true means the user can't edit the contents, false means the contents are editable.

examples.description: Lock the contents of a building block gallery content control to prevent users from editing it

properties.name: placeholderText
properties.description: Returns a BuildingBlock object that represents the placeholder text for the content control.

examples.description: Get and display the placeholder text content from a building block gallery content control

properties.name: range
properties.description: Returns a Range object that represents the contents of the content control in the active document.

examples.description: Get the text content from a building block gallery content control by accessing its range

properties.name: showingPlaceholderText
properties.description: Gets if the placeholder text for the content control is being displayed.

examples.description: Check if a building block gallery content control is currently showing its placeholder text and log the result to the console.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Specifies a tag to identify the content control.

examples.description: Set a tag "product-catalog" on a building block gallery content control to identify it for later retrieval or manipulation.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Specifies the title for the content control.

examples.description: Set the title of a building block gallery content control to "Document Templates"

properties.name: xmlMapping
properties.description: Returns an XmlMapping object that represents the mapping of the content control to XML data in the data store of the document.

examples.description: Check if a building block gallery content control has XML mapping configured and log the mapping details to the console.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies the content control from the active document to the Clipboard.

examples.description: Copy a building block gallery content control to the clipboard so it can be pasted elsewhere in the document

methods.name: cut
methods.description: Removes the content control from the active document and moves the content control to the Clipboard.

examples.description: Remove a building block gallery content control from the document and place it on the clipboard so it can be pasted elsewhere

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the content control and optionally its contents.

params.name: deleteContents
params.description: Optional. Whether to delete the contents inside the control.

examples.description: Delete a building block gallery content control while preserving its contents in the document

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the title and type properties of the first building block gallery content control in the document.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Configure a building block gallery content control by setting multiple properties at once, including its title, appearance, and placeholder text.

methods.name: setPlaceholderText
methods.description: Sets the placeholder text that displays in the content control until a user enters their own text.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for configuring the content control's placeholder text.

examples.description: Set placeholder text for a building block gallery content control to guide users to select a cover page template

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.BuildingBlockGalleryContentControl object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.BuildingBlockGalleryContentControlData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a building block gallery content control to JSON format to log or store its properties

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a building block gallery content control to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls and prevent "InvalidObjectPath" errors when accessing it later in the batch operation.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Insert a building block gallery content control, use it to perform operations, then untrack it to free memory when done.
